snippet: As the body count for Afghan security forces has risen, it has become clear that no one is going to vote on Saturday in embattled districts like Charkh.
abstract: Afghan officials say it is unlikely anyone will come out to vote in national elections in embattled districts like Charkh, where body count for Afghan security forces continues to rise; insurgents have held sway in Charkh for years, including when American forces were present.

byline.contributor: Haris Kakar contributed reporting from Charkh, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: As the body count for Afghan security forces has risen, it has become clear that no one is going to vote on Saturday in embattled districts like Charkh.

headline.main: In Bullet-Ridden Afghan Districts, Free Vote Seems an Empty Promise
headline.print_headline: In Bullet-Ridden Afghan Districts, Free Vote Seems an Empty Promise
